name: Sightless Dungeon
description:
This game is completely played without sight; it has no visuals at all. You must learn what different sounds mean to progress. It is styled similarly to a roguelike in that movement is turn-based, but the levels are static like an adventure game, and it ends up being more of a puzzle game in the end.

Making the game playable for blind people had the effect of making it unplayable by deaf people. Funny how that works. I could always make a deaf-friendly version in the future.

Be sure to read the readme file in the folder for the controls or you won't know how to go past the "title screen."
